list_definition.definition: to (cause to) move or pass along smoothly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Children must not slide in the school corridors.
I slid hurriedly past the window
He slid the book quickly out of sight under his pillow.

list_definition.definition: a slippery track, or apparatus with a smooth sloping surface, on which people or things can slide

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The children were taking turns on the slide in the playground.

list_definition.definition: a small transparent photograph for projecting on to a screen etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The lecture was illustrated with slides.

list_definition.mean_english: bản kính mang vật (ở kính hiển vi)
list_definition.definition: a glass plate on which objects are placed to be examined under a microscope.
(also hair-slide) a (decorative) hinged fastening for the hair.
